required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Uterine Flushing With Human Chorionic Gonadotrophin and Unexplained Infertility
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Uterine Flushing With Human Chorionic Gonadotrophin Before Intrauterine Insemination on Pregnancy and Live Birth Rates in Women With Unexplained Infertility: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective randomized study included 210 women with Unexplained infertility subjected to combined ovarian stimulation and Intrauterine insemination (IUI). Two equal groups. Study group, subjected to uterine flushing with Human chorionic gonadotropin (HCG) one day before IUI and control group subjected to IUI alone.

detailed_description.textblock: A prospective randomized study included 210 patients with Unexplained infertility subjected to coupled ovarian stimulation and Intrauterine insemination (IUI). Two equal groups. Study group, subjected to uterine flushing with Human chorionic gonadotropin (HCG) one day before IUI and control group subjected to IUI alone.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: intrauterine injection of human chorionic gonadotropin before intrauterine insemination (IUI) compared to IUI alone
study_design_info.masking_description: Vaginal flushing with 10 ml saline was performed in the control group

primary_outcome.description: Defined as pregnancies maintained beyond 20 weeks of gestation

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as positive serum pregnancy test
Defined by the presence of gestational sac with fetal heartbeats on ultrasound scan or histological identification of trophoblastic tissue.

arm_group.description: Uterine flushing was done one day before Intrauterine insemination (IUI) with HCG (500 IU) in 10 ml of saline followed by Intrauterine insemination (IUI).
Intrauterine insemination alone plus vaginal flushing with 10 ml normal saline

intervention.description: HCG Uterine flushing was done one day before IUI with HCG (500 IU) in 10 ml of saline.

intervention.intervention_name: Vaginal flushing with 10 ml normal saline
intervention.description: Flushing of the vagina with 10 ml of saline

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Unexplained infertility (UI)
Exclusion Criteria:
- body mass index (BMI) â‰¥35 kg/m2,
- Follicle Stimulating Hormone >10 International Unit /Litter in early follicular phase,
- diagnosed cause of infertility, menstrual cycle irregularity,
- ovarian cysts,
- sever cervical stenosis,
- former IUI,
- ongoing pregnancy and
- renal or hepatic diseases were all the exclusion criteria.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant Professor, Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology, Faculty of Medicine; Banha University
